N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1611.0 - Foreword

State Regulations
(a) This Part
describes the recommended standards for the design and construction of
apartments for senior citizens in low rent State-aided public housing projects, and is intended to serve as a guide. These standards are intended to produce
adequate, safe and sanitary dwellings, at the lowest cost compatible with
economical maintenance and low rent, and which will help preserve the character
of the development during the life of the project. (b) See Part 1610 for recommended standards
for apartments not intended for senior citizens. These standards are for
guidance; however, where the words "shall" or "must" are used, these standards
are mandatory. Housing authorities and architects are expected to use judgment
and imagination. The division will welcome all efforts to improve the
livability, architectural quality, and economical construction and operation of
projects. (c) The commissioner has
no responsibility for the adequacy of design or the technical sufficiency of
plans, specifications and other data submitted for review and approval. Approval, when granted, is only as to compliance with the Public Housing Law, the loan and subsidy contract, the rules and regulations of the commissioner
and this Part. The project shall comply with all pertinent local and State laws
and regulations. Notes
